Hello and welcome to an informational video about the Euro Dice project.
This project is funded by the European Union 7 Framework Program.
The objective of the Euro DICE project is to build across organizational, logistics and transportation framework using an intelligent cargo system.
This video shows the cross organizational transportation process from the viewpoint of intelligent cargo.
Using a classic process oriented transportation chain, the different IT systems of the various companies involved often require paper documentation to accompany each item of cargo.
This can cause significant delays in the handling of the cargo.
An intelligent cargo system does away with the paperwork by providing each item of cargo with the knowledge, intelligence and capabilities to navigate his own way through the transportation process.
Within a common euro dice infrastructure, each item of cargo can actively participate in an support its own handling.
The euro DICE infrastructure is based on multi agent system technology.
Software agents which transformed the cargo into intelligent cargo.
Accompany the cargo items as virtual avatars that represent the cargoes interests.
Additional agents offering services for the intelligent cargo represent containers, trucks, warehouses and other facilities.
The life of each cargo agent starts with the IT system.
When an order is submitted, a mission is generated containing all the information for the transportation process.
This includes the owner of the cargo, the cargo source and destination intermediates.
I spoke before about self identification.
That means I had to know who I am, where I'm going and we call it mission.
The mission is extracted from the enterprise application system that supports deliveries in.
The logistics could be an area ERP process.
Application imagine one of them in the through the RP application you have all the necessary information every every morning.
The delivery manager has to do with a lot of deliveries, so here he schedules the deliveries he make him.
It produces a itinerary plan for its truck.
So this is the mission we are talking about.
Castle, say where I'm going under with with station stops.
Routson trucks the types of guts, etc.
Each agent is then assigned a mission, making it responsible for a specific piece of cargo.
Eventually the cargo is ready to be loaded for transport and the agent is ready to start its mission.
At this time, the agent is transferred to a smart device place close to the item of cargo.
This transforms the cargo into a piece of intelligent cargo.
When the intelligent cargo is loaded into a truck, the car goes and the truck's agents discover each other and start to communicate.
After identifying each other, they check if the item of cargo is being correctly loaded.
In this case, apparently everything is correct.
Once all the items have been loaded into the truck, it is ready for departure.
The truck registers that it has left the loading dock and checks out at the warehouse.

Unfortunately, in this case, an item of cargo has been overlooked and not loaded into the truck by comparing the checking cargo items with the truck shipment plan, intelligent cargo Network discovers the mistake and notifies the back end of the IT system.
The cargos mission is then updated appropriately.
So what happens here is that every cargo is tagged with an RF ID and.
Depending on the year, if you want to follow would be just a simple box, could be a pallet or could be a container.
Every when we print out the mission from the enterprise applicated classification, that is the ERP and we send it to you.
Read it and that it says that I have to load in this track 10 boxes or 10 pallets and it has also the RF ID numbers.
So every time the loading process starts and I move the car go from here and I'm moving to the track, there isn't there isn't enough ID right there.
That reads the incoming goods could be the ballot box whatever, so every time that a good is entering key to the end of the track, then it takes OK.
This is under and at the end in order to have a successful loading, it has to check against the list of what is to be loaded and what has already been loaded.
During transportation, intelligent Cargo is able to monitor its environment.
From the information in its mission.
And background knowledge in the form of an ontology.
It can set observational parameters.
For example, if a cargo item contains fish, it deduces that this is a perishable good, requiring refrigeration, and concludes that the temperature has to be kept within certain thresholds.
It will then ask the truck agent for a local sensor device capable of measuring temperature.
The truck Agent informs it about the sensor device and the intelligent cargo submits a request to be notified when it gets too warm in the truck.
During the transportation process, deviations may occur to the initial mission of an intelligent cargo agent.
For example, a detour due to a construction site may cause the truck to take a different route than was originally planned.
Since the intelligent cargo is monitoring its progress throughout its transportation, it registers such a detour.
The cargo reports the detail to the back end and consults with it for actions to be taken.
The transport management system is able to deduce the alternative route the truck is going to take.
The cargo agent is informed about the new route and updates its mission accordingly.
The construction site requires a large scale detour that will affect the arrival time at the next stop.
The intelligent cargo recognizes that it will miss its next scheduled transport and needs to find alternative transport.
It posed a request in a freight exchange platform.
Looking for transport possibilities from the intermediate warehouse to its final destination.
Once matching transport has been found, the intelligent cargo is informed and the agent updates its mission.
That is the concept of the context awareness.

I have to change the route.

Finally, the truck arrives at the intermediate warehouse.
Upon arrival, it discovers the warehouses agent and starts communicating with it.
The cargo items can then be unloaded and are taken off that shipments list once all the cargo items have been unloaded.
The shipment is regarded as finished and the truck's agent informs the back end system.
The cargo items at the intermediate warehouse now have to be consolidated and made ready for the next shipments.
When the loading step scans a piece of intelligent cargo, the cargo derives relevant information from the local context.
In this case, the agent recognizes that it is currently located in the intermediate warehouse and will be transported to the loading area for shipment.
It therefore presents the waybill contained in its mission.
Which is constantly being updated throughout the transportation process.
After the cargo item has been moved to the appropriate dog, it is loaded into the next truck.

Even though a different company may operate this drug, and even though this item was not initially scheduled for the trip, the common euro DICE platform ensures that the shipment is carried out without deley.
Intelligent cargo finds the same infrastructure in the new truck and can seamlessly communicate with the local devices.

Intelligent Cargo is able to negotiate its way through the whole of the transportation process, react intelligently to unexpected events, and only requires human interaction in the planning stage or when it can't find a solution of its own.
Finally, the cargo arrives at its final destination.
The cargos agents mission is accomplished.

Hello and welcome to an informational video about the Euro Dice project.
This project is funded by the European Union 7 Framework Program.
The objective of the Euro DICE project is to build across organizational, logistics and transportation framework using an intelligent cargo system.
This video shows the cross organizational transportation process from the viewpoint of intelligent cargo.
Using a classic process oriented transportation chain, the different IT systems of the various companies involved often require paper documentation to accompany each item of cargo.
This can cause significant delays in the handling of the cargo.
An intelligent cargo system does away with the paperwork by providing each item of cargo with the knowledge, intelligence and capabilities to navigate his own way through the transportation process.
Within a common euro dice infrastructure, each item of cargo can actively participate in an support its own handling.
The euro DICE infrastructure is based on multi agent system technology.
Software agents which transformed the cargo into intelligent cargo.
Accompany the cargo items as virtual avatars that represent the cargoes interests.
Additional agents offering services for the intelligent cargo represent containers, trucks, warehouses and other facilities.
The life of each cargo agent starts with the IT system.
When an order is submitted, a mission is generated containing all the information for the transportation process.
This includes the owner of the cargo, the cargo source and destination intermediates.
I spoke before about self identification.
That means I had to know who I am, where I'm going and we call it mission.
The mission is extracted from the enterprise application system that supports deliveries in.
The logistics could be an area ERP process.
Application imagine one of them in the through the RP application you have all the necessary information every every morning.
The delivery manager has to do with a lot of deliveries, so here he schedules the deliveries he make him.
It produces a itinerary plan for its truck.
So this is the mission we are talking about.
Castle, say where I'm going under with with station stops.
Routson trucks the types of guts, etc.

Eventually the cargo is ready to be loaded for transport and the agent is ready to start its mission.
At this time, the agent is transferred to a smart device place close to the item of cargo.
This transforms the cargo into a piece of intelligent cargo.
When the intelligent cargo is loaded into a truck, the car goes and the truck's agents discover each other and start to communicate.

During transportation, intelligent Cargo is able to monitor its environment.
From the information in its mission.
And background knowledge in the form of an ontology.
It can set observational parameters.
For example, if a cargo item contains fish, it deduces that this is a perishable good, requiring refrigeration, and concludes that the temperature has to be kept within certain thresholds.
It will then ask the truck agent for a local sensor device capable of measuring temperature.
The truck Agent informs it about the sensor device and the intelligent cargo submits a request to be notified when it gets too warm in the truck.
During the transportation process, deviations may occur to the initial mission of an intelligent cargo agent.
For example, a detour due to a construction site may cause the truck to take a different route than was originally planned.
Since the intelligent cargo is monitoring its progress throughout its transportation, it registers such a detour.
The cargo reports the detail to the back end and consults with it for actions to be taken.
The transport management system is able to deduce the alternative route the truck is going to take.
The cargo agent is informed about the new route and updates its mission accordingly.
The construction site requires a large scale detour that will affect the arrival time at the next stop.
The intelligent cargo recognizes that it will miss its next scheduled transport and needs to find alternative transport.
It posed a request in a freight exchange platform.
Looking for transport possibilities from the intermediate warehouse to its final destination.
Once matching transport has been found, the intelligent cargo is informed and the agent updates its mission.
